column1: question
A full box has 15 pieces of chalk. My box only has 5 pieces. How many pieces of chalk are missing?
The grasshopper and the frog had a jumping contest. The grasshopper jumped 25 inches. The frog jumped 15 inches farther than the grasshopper. How far did the frog jump?
The high temperature today was 98 degrees. The low temperature was 67 degrees. What is the difference between the two temperatures?
Jeri is thinking of a mystery number. If she divides it by 9 and then subtracts 7 from it, the result is 1. What is Jeri's mystery number?
Last year, Scout Troop # 85 sold 540 boxes of cookies. This year, they sold 783 boxes. What was the percent increase in the number of boxes sold?
The library had a book fair. The sold 386 children's books. They also sold 158 mystery books. How many books did the library sell altogether?
A quarter weighs about 6 grams. A dime weighs about 2 grams. What is the difference in weight between $26.00 in quarters and $ 26.00 in dimes?
Last year, Omar read 15 books. This year, he read 6 books in April and 8 books in May. How many books has Omar read this year?
Rachel collected 635 soccer cards. She collected 241 more cards than Tori. How many cards did Tori collect?
Connie saved up $39. She wants to buy a watch that costs $55. How much more money does Connie need?
Evan has a large collection of books. He gave his best friend 14 books. He gave his little brother 8 books. Now Evan has 60 books in his collection. How many books did he have at first?
London is 11 years old and Blair is 16 years old. Several years ago, Blair was twice as old as London. How old was London then? (Hint: Make a chart.)
Nicholas is 11 years old today. How old was Nicholas 5 years ago?
The coach bought 46 T-shirts for the team. There were 15 large shirts and 31 small ones. 21 team members got their T-shirts after the game. How many team members did not get a T-shirt?

Bridget needs to make rectangular cards measuring 2 inches by 3 inches. She will cut them from a square sheet of poster board measuring 1 foot on each side. What is the greatest number of cards that Bridget can make?
35 campers went rowing in the morning. 27 campers went rowing in the afternoon. How many campers went rowing in all?
The Sweet Shop gets a new candy shipment every 35 days. There are 25 cases of chocolate bars. There are 55 cases of lollipops. How many cases of candy altogether?
11 clowns were wearing polka dot pants. 5 clowns were wearing striped pants. How many more clowns were wearing polka dot pants?
There are 3 packs of crayons available for every 5 students in the art class. How many students can share 15 packs of crayons?
Tuition at the music school is $45 per person. There is a $15 discount for siblings. Ali and her brother, Matt, signed up for classes. How much will it cost for both children?
Drew gave 12 marbles to Marcus. Each boy then had 25 marbles. How many more marbles did Drew have than Marcus at first?
Frannie and Meg are in a jump rope contest. Frannie jumped 53 times without missing. She jumped 18 fewer times than Meg. How many times did Meg jump?
Brad and Kyle measured how high they can jump. Brad jumped 54 centimeters. He is 62 inches tall. Kyle jumped 41 centimeters. How many centimeters higher did Brad jump?
Mindy blew up 24 red balloons and 15 white balloons. 7 of the balloons popped. How many balloons did Mindy have then?
On the nature walk, Lana saw 16 different animals. She saw 5 squirrels, 4 woodpeckers, and some chipmunks. How many chipmunks did Lana see?
Jack’s father said that he would pay 60% of the cost of a bicycle. The bicycle costs $350. How much will Jack’s father pay?
There are 642 students at Memorial School. 295 students have pets. How many students do not have pets?

Tina had a large collection of beanie babies. She gave 8 beanie babies to her cousin. She gave half that amount to her sister. She gave 36 beanie babies to needy children. She kept 12 for herself. How many beanie babies were in Tina's collection at first?
Jordon put a new number into her machine. The machine doubled it then added 3 more. The number 27 came out of the machine. What number do you think Jordon put in her machine?
Kyle bought 3 presents. The first present cost $18. The second present cost $7 more than the first. The third present cost $11 less than the first. How much did Kyle pay for all 3 presents?
There are 15 activities in the physics room. Danny has tried 7 activities. How many activities does Danny have left to try?
There were 18 girls and 15 boys on the track team. 7 more girls joined the team. 4 boys quit the team. How many children were on the track team then?
December is a busy month for the toy store. They had 95 games on the shelf. 68 games were sold the first week. The store got 47 more games from the factory. How many games did they have then?
The music room has 27 violins. There are also 15 flutes. 18 students are in the school band. How many instruments are in the music room?
Molly and Ted built pens for their dogs. Molly made a pen 12 meters by 8 meters. Ted's pen is 15 meters by 6 meters. Who will need more fencing to build the pen?/div> CheckShow answer
Amber is 9 years old. Amber's sister is 6 years older. How old is Amber's sister?
North High School has 127 band members. South High School has 34 more members in their band. How many members are in South High School's band?
Andrew needs 9 rubberbands for each puppet he makes. He has 77 rubberbands. How many puppets can Andrew make?
7 children were waiting in line to see the magic show. 8 more children came. 5 children left to buy popcorn. How many children were standing in line then?

Bridget wants to win the giant stuffed panda bear. She needs a total of 75 points to get it. Bridget already scored 35 points at the penny pitch booth. She scored 18 more points on her next try. How many more points does Bridget need?
If a store manager sells a television set for 75% of its cost, its price will be $675. The manager wants to make $125 profit. What should the selling price be?
Julie climbed 15 steps up the giant slide. She climbed down 6 steps to talk to her friend, Maria. Then she climbed up 8 steps to get to the top. How many steps does the slide have?
Mario made 18 posters to help advertise the fair. Samantha made 15 more posters than Mario. How many posters did they make altogether?
Dani bought a CD on sale for 75% off the regular price. She paid $3.50. What was the regular price?
Alex, Brad, Calvin, and Dennis are playing checkers. Each of the 4 boys played 2 games with every other player. How many games of checkers were played altogether?
Lori bought a soccer ball for $19.95 She also bought a pair of sneakers that cost three times as much as the ball. She had $7.80 left in her backpack. How much money did she have before the purchase?
Jonah had 50 paperback books. He donated 7/10 of the books to the book fair. How many books did Jonah keep?
Lori used 1/4 of her rubberbands in a project. She had 27 rubberbands left. How many rubberbands did Lori use in her project?
The snack bar sold 435 drinks on Saturday. It sold 190 drinks in the morning. How many drinks were sold in the afternoon?
David spent 74 cents. He bought a ruler for 29 cents and a folder for 25 cents. He also bought 2 pencils. How much does one pencil cost?

A box of apples was delivered to Paul's Pies and Cakes. He put half of the apples aside for a pie he would make later. He put 25 of the remaining apples in the refrigerator. That left 6 apples to use in his muffins. How many apples were in the box at first?
The area of square photo is 25 square inches. Angie decided to enlarge the photo by doubling the sides. What will the new area be?
Tripp and Charlotte are going on a 36 mile hike. Tripp's backpack weighs 25 pounds. Charlotte's back pack weighs 7 pounds less. They hiked 9 miles the first day. How many miles do they have left?

Corey earns extra money finding lost golf balls. His goal is to find 48 golfballs every weekend. He found 16 golf balls on Saturday. He found 18 more golf balls on Sunday. How many more golf balls does Corey need to find to reach his goal?
Jason scored 27 goals in hockey last season. He scored 21 goals this season. How many goals did Jason score in all?
Mrs. Carson had 32 cupcakes. She gave an equal number of cupcakes to each of her 9 students. She brought the remaining ones home. How many cupcakes did Mrs. Carson bring home?
Fran has 72 cents. Hilary has 30 cents less than Fran. How much money does Hilary have?
Lou's Shoes must sell 80 pairs of shoes each month. They sold 27 pairs last week and 12 pairs this week. How many more pairs of shoes must they sell?
Terry cut a rope 35 inches long into two pieces in the ratio 3:4. What is the length of the longer piece?
At Pizza Palace, 1 large and 2 small pizzas cost the same as 5 small pizzas. A small pizza costs $4. What is the cost of a large pizza?
Craig and Brian looked for seashells. For every 9 seashells Craig found, Brian found 7. Craig found 54 seashells. How many fewer seashells did Brian find than Craig?

The Chocolate Factory has to package 60 pounds of chocolate. Each box must contain 3/4 pound of chocolate. Each box is then sold for $3.50. If all of the boxes are sold, how much will the Chocolate Factory collect?
Brian ordered 440 turkey sandwiches for the party. He also ordered 365 ham sandwiches. There were 187 sandwiches left after the party. How many sandwiches were eaten?
Molly swam 45 meters on Saturday. She swam 28 meters on Sunday. The pool is 25 meters long. How many meters did Molly swim in all?
Rachel invited 11 friends to her birthday party. 8 friends came. How many friends did not come?
Curt filled 120 cups with juice for the party. He placed 15 cups on each tray. He accidentally spilled 3 trays of juice. How many trays of juice does he still have for the party?
Kevin collected toys to use as prizes at the fair. He collected 14 stuffed animals. He also collected 18 frisbees and several yo-yos. Kevin has 50 prizes in all. How many yo-yos did Kevin collect?
The toy store has 48 games. It has 31 puzzles. How many more games does the store have?
The Morrison family is having a cookout. They bought 4 packs of hot dogs and 6 packs of hamburgers. They also bought 12 packs of rolls. How many packs of hot dogs and hamburgers did they buy?

Ernie and Bert together have 200 stickers. They want to have the same number of stickers. To do that, Ernie has to give Bert 42 stickers. How many stickers did Bert have at first? Hint: How many stickers would Ernie and Bert have if they had the same amount?

A banquet hall has guest tables that seat 12 people each. There are 9 adults at each table. The rest of the table space is occupied by children. There are 72 adults at the banquet. How many guests are there altogether?
Luis and Cameron shared some stickers is the ratio 5:2. Luis received 15 more stickers than Cameron. How many stickers were there altogether?
A square kitchen has an area of 100 square feet. What is the kitchen’s perimeter?
Lucy rode the merry-go-round 7 times yesterday and 8 times today. How many times did she ride the merry-go-round altogether?

The Amazing Adventures of Astro is coming to the theatre this weekend. Each ticket costs $4.50. Tickets purchased in pairs cost $7.50. What is least amount of money it will cost to buy 9 tickets cost?
Malcolm's Farm has two kinds of fruit trees. They have 47 apple trees. The have 41 pear trees. How many fruit trees do they have in all?
Josh bought a bat for $15. He also bought a mitt for $21. How much did Josh spend altogether?
Elizabeth studied 25 minutes for her science test. She studied 35 minutes for her math test. How long did Elizabeth study altogether?
Chef Pillsbury purchased some eggs. He used 1/2 of them to make some pies. He used 1/4 of the remaining eggs to make a cake. He then had 15 eggs left. How many eggs had Chef Pillsbury purchased?
Anne ate 6 cookies. Samantha ate 4 more cookies than Anne. How many cookies did Samantha eat?
The library purchased 320 new books this year. 168 of the new books are fiction. How many of the new books are not fiction?
The Smart Mart sells educational toys. They sold 45 science kits last week. The sold 9 fewer puzzles than science kits. How many puzzles did the Smart Mart sell?
Mike delivered 36 newspapers after school. Nancy delivered 12 more newspapers than Mike. Altogether, 28 boys and girls delivered papers after school. How many newspapers did Nancy deliver?
Danny and his sister, Emma, built towers with newspaper rods. Emma's tower was 12 feet tall. Danny's tower was 9 feet tall. How much taller was Emma's tower?

A number machine changes the value of the numbers placed inside it. My number machine will add 15 to a number and then subtract 6 from the sum. If I put in the number 68, what number will come out of the machine?
Diane's father gave her 6 pennies on Monday. He then gave her 3 pennies every day for the next 4 days. How many pennies did Diane have then?
I had exactly 18 lollipops. I gave away 4, lost 2, and ate 5 of them. How many lollipops did I have then?
Ben and Matt received votes in the ratio 2:3. The total number of votes cast was 60. How many votes did Ben get?
In order to pass her driving test, Lori must answer 75% of the questions correctly. There are a total of 84 questions. How many questions will Lori need to answer correctly to pass the test?
David has 13 balloons. Amy has 7 balloons. How many more balloons does David have than Amy?

Jason has two pet frogs. Freddie the Frog can jump 54 centimeters. Teddy the Tadpole can jump 32 centimeters. Jason found a new frog that can jump 76 centimeters. How much farther can the new frog jump than Freddie?
Katie is having fun measuring things. This is what she discovered: 2 straws are as long as 5 crayons. 15 crayons are as long as 28 paperclips. How many paperclips are as long as 3 straws?
Todd read 137 pages of his book last week. He read 95 pages this week. He only has 54 pages left to read. How many pages are in Todd's book?

The Community Fund donated $1,500.00 to the school to support the band, the sports program, and the photography club. The sports program spent twice as much as the band. The photography club spent three times as much as the band. How much did the sports program spend?
I have a number machine that adds 6, subtracts 2, and then adds 9. If I give my machine the number 5, what number will come out?

Angela spent the day at the beach. She saw 12 children swimming in the ocean. 15 children were playing in the sand. 20 children were splashing in the wading pool. How many children did Angela see at the beach?
Evan and Brin are building a wall with blocks. Evan's wall was 3 blocks high and 6 blocks long. Brin's wall is 5 blocks high and 4 blocks long. How many more blocks did Brin use?
5/7 of a group of students are boys. There are 18 more boys than girls. How many students are there altogether?
Tommy has $79. He wants to buy a $35 camera. He also wants to buy a $59 CD player. How much more money does Tommy need?
Charlene made 60 bead necklaces. She sold 16 at a craft fair. She gave 18 to her friends. How many necklaces did Charlene have then?
Eric has to pack 60 books into boxes. He had 7 boxes that would each hold 8 books. How many books will not fit into the boxes?
The library has 215 books about sports. There are also 157 books about science. How many more books are there about sports?
The band has a huge collection of sheet music. They have 321 sheets of popular music. They have 46 fewer sheets of classical music. How many sheets of classical music do they have?
Jack sold 68 hot dogs at the baseball game. He also sold 27 bags of peanuts. He made $42 today. How many more hot dogs did Jack sell than peanuts?
The dance troupe used ribbob to form a rectangle. The rectangle was 20 feet long and 15 feet wide. How long was the piece of ribbon?
A clown juggled 7 red balls. Another clown tossed him 5 more balls. How many balls was the clown juggling then?
There are 524 books in the children's section of the library. 146 were checked out over the weekend. How many books were left?
Ricky bought 15 tickets. He went on the Rocket first. Then he went on the Twister. How many tickets did he have left?
Britta had 62 stickers. She bought some more. Then she had 78 stickers. How many stickers did she buy?
My sister and I made snow balls after the big storm. I made 25 snowballs. My sister made 13 more snowballs than me. How many snowballs did my sister make?
Greg has 18 coins. Half of the coins are nickels. The rest are dimes. How much money does Greg have?
16 children are in the school play. 7 are playing bumble bees and 4 are playing flowers. The rest are playing trees. How many children are playing trees?
Jeff had 58 stickers. He used 16 of them this morning. He gave 10 to his friend Ed. How many stickers did Jeff have then?
Jason has 375 baseball cards. Kyle has 148 fewer cards than Jason. How many cards do they have together?
Gail made 3 snowballs. Luis made twice as many snowballs. How many snowballs did they make together?
177 people watched the swim club's first meet. 188 people watched the second meet. How many people watched the swim club in all?
Carla bought a piece of ribbon that measured 1 meter in length. She used 1/4 of the ribbon on a gift box. She used 1/8 of the ribbon to make a bow. What fraction of her ribbon was left?

Lizzie has a paper route after school. Her mother drives the car while Lizzie throws the papers. She has 90 papers to deliver. Lizzie missed the front door 4 times as often as she got it. How many papers landed at the front door?

What is the fewest number of marbles that Jeff could have? Here are the clues: When he puts them in groups of 3, there are no marbles remaining. When he puts them in groups of 2 or 5, there is one marble left.
Jasper is in charge of the refreshments. He sold 27 bags of chips. He sold 8 fewer hot dogs than chips. He sold 12 more drinks than hot dogs. How many drinks did Jasper sell?
Scott bought lunch for his friends at the Happy Hamburger. The total bill was $24. Scott decided to leave a 15% tip for the waiter. How much was the tip?
Mrs. Larson likes to put her students' projects on display. There are 7 sculptures and 8 paintings. How many projects are on display?
There are 24 puppies in the pet parade. 13 kittens are wearing ribbons. There are 5 more kittens than puupies. How many kittens are in the parade?
427 tickets were sold for the play this weekend. Eric counted 295 chairs in the auditorium. How many more chairs are needed?
Kendra learns 12 new spelling words each week. Her goal is to learn 60 new words before her eighth birthday. She has already learned 36 new words. How many more words does Kendra need to learn?
Curt has some change in his pocket. He has 3 quarters, 2 dimes, and some nickels. Altogether, he has $1.30. How many nickels does Curt have?
There are 18 people at the beach on a cold, windy day. 6 people are flying box kites. 4 people are flying diamond kites. How many people are not flying kites?

There are four pieces of paper in a bag. Each paper has a number on it. The numbers are 19, 23, 34, and 38. Harry took out one piece of paper. The sum of the remaining numbers was 76. What number did Harry remove from the bag?
There were 15 prizes on the shelf at the game booth. 6 children won prizes. Then 4 more children won prizes. How many prizes were left?
Two numbers are in the ratio 3: 8. Their sum is 44. What is the difference between the two numbers?
Miguel has to bring 30 cupcakes to school. Cupcakes are sold in packages of 8. How many packages should Miguel buy?
At Tot Toys, a toy car costs $4 less than a toy rocket. A toy rocket costs $11. How much does the toy car cost?
Ralph has a photo album with 50 pages. He has 26 pictures of wild animals. Ralph's friend, Derrick, has 34 pictures of wild animals. How many fewer pictures of wild animals does Ralph have?
Mr. Kroft is a mail carrier. He delivered 378 pieces of mail before lunch. He delivered 445 pieces of mail after lunch. How many pieces of mail did he deliver in all?
Austin gave away 25% of his baseball collection. He had 345 baseball cards left. How many baseball cards were in his collection originally?
There are 42 boys in the computer club. There are 9 fewer girls than boys in the club. How many children are in the computer club altogether?
Todd had 85 cents in his pocket. He bought a candy bar for 14 cents. He bought a box of cookies for 39 cents. How much money did Todd spend altogether?

The ski resort reported 65 inches of snow in January. They measured 18 inches of snow during the first week. They measured 25 inches of snow the second week. How much snow did they get the rest of the month?
480 cans were collected during the recycling program this year. 165 fewer cans were collected last year. How many cans were collected in both years?
The circus clowns had 95 balloons. They gave away 55 balloons. How many balloons did they have left?

A length of wire is cut into several smaller pieces. Each of the smaller pieces are bent into squares. Each square has a side that measures 2 centimeters. The total area of the smaller squares is 92 square centimeters. What was the original length of wire?

It is 78 miles to Grandma's house. Mr. Welch drove 35 miles. He stopped to buy a pie for dessert. Then he drove 18 miles and stopped to put gas in the car. How many more miles until he reaches Grandma's house?
Maggie, Tom, and Andy have some cookies. Maggie has 6 cookies. She has 2 more cookies than Tom and 1 less cookie than Andy. How many cookies do they have altogether?
A comic book costs 37 cents. The store owner reversed the digits by mistake. He wrote that number on the comic book. How much did the store owner overcharge his customer?
The ratio of Kate's stickers to Jenna's stickers is 7:4. Kate has 21 stickers. How many stickers does Jenna have?
Belle collected 97 animal stickers. Carolyn collected 18 fewer stickers than Belle. How many stickers did Carolyn collect?

Greg's mom made some cookies for the family. The cookies were so huge that she decided to cut them in half. Greg ate 4 halves and his brother, Brad, had 6 halves. There were 18 halves left. How many whole cookies did Greg's mom make?
Mrs. Randall has taught third grade for 18 years. She has 26 students this year. She also taught second grade for 8 years. How many years has Mrs. Randall been teaching?
Alvin had 57 marbles and played two games. He lost 18 marbles during the first game. He won 25 marbles during the second game. How many marbles did Alvin have then?
Mark had 24 marbles and Evan had 3 marbles. Mark gave some of his marbles to Evan. Now Mark has exactly double the number of marbles that Evan has. How many marbles did Mark give to Evan?
A book has two chapters. The first chapter is 48 pages long. The second chapter is 46 pages long. How many pages does the book have altogether?
Melissa keeps all her art projects in a giant folder. She has 4 pencil sketches and 6 paintings. How many art projects does she have altogether?
Trevor counted 77 coins in his bank. He counted 29 quarters. The rest are dimes. How many more dimes than quarters does Trevor have?
Ethan has a balance scale. He found that 2 blue blocks will balance 1 red block. A blue block weighs 258 grams. How much does a red block weigh?
A piece of square paper has a perimeter of 32 centimeters. Nicky's dog, Rocky, tore off 1/4 of the paper. What is the area of the remaining paper?
It costs $8.75 to buy a ticket for the zoo. How much change would you receive from $100 to buy tickets for a family of 4?
The school band is getting ready for a concert. They practiced 115 minutes on Monday and 125 minutes on Tuesday. How many minutes did the band practice on both days?
For every 3 sit-ups Peter does, Greg does 4. Peter did 24 sit-ups. How many sit-ups did Greg do?
The length of a rectangular field is 75 meters. Its width is 15 meters. Sofie ran around the track 3 times. How far did she run?
Madison makes her own bracelets. She used 7 inches of elastic for each one. She has 40 inches of elastic. How many bracelets can Madison make?
The library has 75 science books. The second graders borrowed 18 of them. How many science books are left?

A book distributor orders 375 copies of a book on deep sea exploration. It will evenly distribute the copies to 15 bookstores. Each bookstore pays $9.20 per copy. If the store owner wants to make a total of $350, what should be the selling price of a single book?
The math club solved 728 problems in October. They solved 115 more problems than that in November. How many problems did they solve in November?
Ali just got her allowance. She spent 7 cents to buy gum and 4 cents for a sticker. She gave her sister 5 cents. How much did Ali spend altogether?
Chef Pillsbury's secret recipe requires 7 eggs for every 2 cups of flour. How many eggs will he need if he uses 8 cups of flour?
Mrs. Griffin went to the grocery store with $70. She had $16 left after shopping. How much did Mrs. Griffin spend?
Monica had 6 markers. Her mother gave her 8 more markers. Monica had to throw away 5 of the markers. How many markers did Monica have then?

Students at Memorial School voted for their favorite snack. For every 5 students that voted for candy, 2 students voted for popcorn. There were a total of 45 votes for candy. How many fewer students voted for popcorn than candy?
Jill had $563. She went to the mall to buy a DVD player. Then she had $380 left. How much did Jill pay for the DVD player?
Trevor has a giant baseball card collection. He had 112 doubles so he gave those to his brother. Now Trevor has 795 cards. How many baseball cards did Trevor have at first?
Maddie, Luisa, and Amy counted their books. Maddie had 15 books. Luisa had 18 books. Together, Amy and Luisa had 9 more books than Maddie. How many books did Amy have?

Martin works at the Hungry Hippo. He sells 48 hamburgers before 6 of the clock. He sells 28 more hamburgers than that after 6 of the clock. He works 24 hours each week. How many hamburgers does Martin sell after 6 of the clock?
Dora is having her tenth birthday party next Saurday. She invited 64 people. Her mom ordered 36 sandwiches. 16 people can not come to the party. How many people will be at Dora's party?
Mr. Clark gave 4 lollipops to each of his 8 students. Now he only has 19 lollipops left. How many lollipops did Mr. Clark have at first?
862 peple ran in the marathon this year. 591 people crossed the finish line. How many people did not finish the marathon?
The sum of two numbers is 16. One number is 4 more than 5. What is the other number?
Mom gave Melissa 10 cherries. Melissa ate 3 of them. Mom gave Melissa 8 more cherries. How many cherries did Mom give Melissa in all?
Laurie has 12 more marbles than Kurt. Kurt has 45 marbles less than Dennis. Dennis has 70 marbles. How many marbles does Laurie have?
Greg had $225 in his saving account. He spent 20% of his money on a present for his friend. How much money did Greg have left?

Grandma has an old family recipe for blueberry pancakes. She can make 8 pancakes that are each 10 inches in diameter. Grandma decided that the pancakes were way too large for her grandchildren and decided to make pancakes that were only 2 inches in diameter. How many small pancakes will Grandma's recipe make?
Zachary is thinking of a mystery number. If he divides his number by 4 and then multiplies it by 5, the result is 135. What is Zachary’s mystery number?
Greta had 12 candy bars and Sean had 4 candy bars. Greta ate 1 of her candy bars and gave 3 of her candy bars to Sean. How many more candy bars did Greta have than Sean then?
Richard and Bruno played miniature golf. Richard's score was 62. Bruno's score was 14 points lower than Richard's score. What was Bruno's score?

There is a frog jumping contest in Hippity Hop County. Leaping Larry jumps 18 cm every 6 seconds. Bouncing Billy jumps 7 cm every 3 seconds. What is the difference in the distance they jumped at the end of one minute?

The first graders collected 8 cans of food for the food drive. The second graders collected 15 cans of food. The third graders collected 18 cans of food. How many more cans of food did the third graders collect than the first graders?
Danny collects bottle caps. He found 18 bottle caps at the park. Now he has 55 bottle caps in his collection. How many bottle caps did Danny have at first?
David saved $935. Michael saved $248 less than David. How much money did Michael save?
Ryan did 145 sit ups on Monday. He did 19 fewer sit ups on Tuesday. How many sit ups did Ryan do on Tuesday?
William has 4 pieces of wood with a total length of 35 feet. Three of the pieces are the same length, and one piece is 8 feet long. How long are the other pieces?
If our class makes 18 posters, we will get a pizza party. Catherine made 4 posters. Matthew made 6 posters. How many more posters does the class need to make?
Chris has 18 soccer cards. His friend, Charlie, has 32 cards. How many fewer cards does Chris have?
The tallest giraffe at the zoo is 96 inches tall. There are 14 adult giraffes at the zoo. The shortest giraffe is 68 inches. How much taller is the bigger giraffe?
Eric has two pieces of rope. One piece is 10 inches longer than the other. The total length of the two pieces is 40 inches. How long is the shorter piece?
96 children are at the park. 11 children are flying kites. 36 children are playing games. How many more children are playing games than flying kites?
1/3 of a pole is painted red. 1/2 of it is painted blue. Three feet of the pole is painted green. What is the height of the pole?
The Flying Eagles football team won 18 out of 24 games Assuming no ties, what percent of the games did they lose?
Laurie had 24 pumpkin seeds. She also had 35 apple seeds. She planted 42 of the seeds. How many seeds did Laurie have left?
The book store is very busy today. There are 25 children listening to a story. 36 people are shopping for books. 17 people are at the checkout counter. How many people are at the bookstore?
Greg and Peter bought a large pizza to share. Greg ate 5/8 of the pizza. What fraction of the pizza was left for Peter?
